news.title: Texas Tries a Pandemic First: A Jury Trial By Zoom
news.description: A Collin County court convened a remote jury for a “summary jury trial” in which they would assemble via videoconference and deliver a non-binding verdict in an insurance dispute.

news.title: Managing Caseloads Remotely During Coronavirus
news.description: Tips for managing your firm’s workflow on a remote basis during the pandemic include embracing tech, outsourcing time-consuming tasks, and taking advantage of slow times.

news.title: Expanded Online Law Classes Could Continue Under Plan Endorsed by ABA Legal Ed Council
news.description: The ABA is considering revisions to a rule that limits the amount of online education that accredited law schools can offer so that these restrictions can be relaxed during emergencies.

news.title: Key Factors for Closing Transactions Remotely
news.description: Attorneys completing deals remotely due to the COVID-19 outbreak should be familiar with electronic signature options, and also be aware of requirements for things like notarization.
